program_menu module¶

This module acts as a menu interface for performing the experiments

program_menu.ask_for_configuration()¶

Asks the user for the following configurations for a test:

  • Dataset

  • Optimizer (between the supported types)

  • Load of a checkpoint (Optional)

  • Learning Rate (Optional)

  • Summary Interval (Optional)

  • Checkpoint Interval (Optional)

  • Seed for random numbers (Optional)

Returns

a tuple containing 3 strings, 2 ints and a float: name of the dataset (str), name of the optimizer (str), representation of a checkpoint (str), summary interval (int), checkpoint interval (int) and seed (float) in that order. The representation of a checkpoint will be returned as None if the user doesn’t configure it. An example of a return value is: (‘MNIST’, ‘TR_BASE’, None, 100, 300, 12345).

program_menu.configure_checkpoint(curr_ckp: str)¶

Configures a representation of a checkpoint based in the corresponding increment (mega-batch) and iteration given by the user. Notice that this function DOES NOT check if the given checkpoint is valid. Also, the full checkpoint path must be created at a later moment, since that path is heavily dependent of other parameters like Dataset and Optimizer that may change during configuration time.

Parameters

curr_ckp – a string representing the increment and iteration of a checkpoint. It must be in the form: “[increment]-[iteration]”, e.g. “1-20”

Returns

a string representing the new checkpoint if the user has changed it, otherwise, the current checkpoint will be returned. A value of None will be returned if there was a checkpoint already configured and the user decided to not load a checkpoint anymore.

Return type

str

program_menu.configure_dataset_and_neural_net(curr_dataset: str)¶

Configures the optimizer appropriately

Parameters

curr_dataset – the current dataset that has been configured by the user

Returns

a str representing the new dataset if the user has changed it to a valid value, otherwise, the current dataset will be returned

Return type

str

program_menu.configure_intervals(curr_s_interval: int, curr_ckp_interval: int)¶

Configures the summary interval and checkpoint interval

Parameters

  • curr_s_interval – the current summary interval that has been configured by the user

  • curr_ckp_interval – the current checkpoint interval that has been configured by the user

Returns

a tuple with 2 integers: the new summary interval and the new checkpoint interval if the user has changed them to a valid value, otherwise, the current summary and checkpoint intervals will be returned

program_menu.configure_optimizer(curr_optimizer: str)¶

Configures the optimizer appropriately

Parameters

curr_optimizer – the current optimizer that has been configured by the user

Returns

a str representing the new optimizer if the user has changed it to a valid value, otherwise, the current optimizer will be returned

Return type

str

program_menu.configure_seed(curr_seed: int)¶

Asks the user for the seed for random number generators

Parameters

curr_seed – the current value of the seed

Returns

an int corresponding to the new seed if the user has changed it to a valid value, otherwise, the current seed will be returned

Return type

int

program_menu.get_checkpoint()¶

Ask the user for the values of increment and iteration for the checkpoint

Returns

a string representing the increment and iteration, with the format “[increment]-[iteration]”, e.g. “0-50”

Return type

str

program_menu.get_checkpoint_multiplier()¶

Ask the user for the multiplier for the checkpoint interval, since this interval must be a multiple of the summary interval

Returns

an int greater than 0 that corresponds to the multiplier selected by the User, or -1 if the User cancels the operation

Return type

int

program_menu.main()¶

Executes the program

Returns

None

program_menu.print_menu()¶

Prints the menu for the configuration of a Test

Returns

a str, corresponding to the response of the user

program_menu.reset_checkpoint(curr_ckp: str)¶

Resets the checkpoint

Parameters

curr_ckp – a string representing the increment and iteration of a checkpoint.

Returns

None if the checkpoint is reset, otherwise, the current checkpoint will be returned

Return type

str
